Sue Alenick.about: Traditional and modern hand-quilted and patchwork items including: quilts, pillows, pot holders, aprons, placemats and wall hangings.

Ann Baldau.about: Living Art, tillandsia (air plants) mounted on natural materials. Bee's Wax Tapers

Stephanie Bertoni.about: Ceramic Artist. Working with Vermont barn boards from the early 1800s, I  create ceramic trays, bowls, and more that reflect the grains and texture in  each piece.

Brian Bedard.about: Wooden small  clocks, serving trays, coaster sets, Lazy Susan, cutting boards, napkin holders  and more.

Heidi Chamberlain.about: Original  linoleum block prints and cards, cross stitched designs, monoprints and  children's book.

Janet L. Chambers.about: Hand knit scarves, scartles, fingerless gloves and children's hats. VHC Member

Kathryne DeBari.about: Luxury hand dyed yarns, Botanical Prints on Silk Scarves and fabric

Linda James.about: Vintage and costume jewelry from the 1890 through the 70's is deconstructed and then reconstructed into contemporary styles. They could be viewed as a 3-D collage, but we simply call them fabulous art wear.

Patti Malone.about: Wearable art created by wire wrapping beautiful  stones, both semi-precious and precious in sterling silver or 14 karat gold  filled wire.

Lori Pietropaoli.about: Functional  fused glass art, including bowls, dishes and ornaments.

Lynn Ann Powers.about: Original mixed media painting and shadowbox of trout fly.

Rick Riani.about: Driftwood Sculptures from  Lake Champlain wood finds.

Ben Thurber.about: Pen and ink sketches rendered in a variety of  forms: note cards, calendars, prints, imbedded in marble & ceramics. VHC Member

Francis Williams.about: Hand turned wooden items for home  and personal use. Don't miss the buttons!

Cynthia Wojtyna.about: Handmade  USDA certified organic body and hair care
